Analysis: Based on your measurements and goals, it is recommended to focus on a balanced diet that includes lean protein sources, plenty of vegetables, whole grains, and healthy fats. It is important to manage your diabetes and allergies by avoiding foods that may cause spikes in blood sugar or allergic reactions.
Recommendations: A suitable diet for you would be a pescetarian meal plan that includes 3 main meals and 2 snacks per day. It is recommended to spread your meals evenly throughout the day and include a variety of nutrient-dense foods. Fasting or any other methods should be discussed with your healthcare provider to ensure they are safe for your specific condition.

Monday: Breakfast: Oatmeal with berries and almond milk
Snack: Greek yogurt with mixed nuts
Lunch: Quinoa salad with roasted vegetables
Snack: Carrot sticks with hummus
Dinner: Grilled salmon with steamed broccoli and quinoa
Tuesday: Breakfast: Scrambled tofu with spinach and whole grain toast
Snack: Apple slices with almond butter
Lunch: Lentil soup with a side salad
Snack: Celery sticks with peanut butter substitute
Dinner: Baked cod with roasted Brussels sprouts and brown rice
Wednesday: Breakfast: Smoothie with spinach, banana, almond milk, and chia seeds
Snack: Mixed berries with a handful of almonds
Lunch: Chickpea salad with mixed greens
Snack: Rice cakes with avocado
Dinner: Grilled shrimp with zucchini noodles and tomato sauce
Thursday: Breakfast: Whole grain cereal with almond milk and sliced banana
Snack: Trail mix with dried fruits and seeds
Lunch: Vegetable stir-fry with tofu
Snack: Cucumber slices with tahini
Dinner: Baked halibut with roasted asparagus and quinoa
Friday: Breakfast: Veggie omelette with whole grain toast
Snack: Orange slices with a handful of walnuts
Lunch: Black bean and corn salad with avocado
Snack: Edamame beans
Dinner: Grilled vegetable skewers with brown rice
